<h1 id="firstHeading" class="firstHeading" lang="en">VTB Ice Palace</h1>
<div id="bodyContent" class="mw-body-content">
<div id="siteSub">From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia</div>
<div id="contentSub"></div>
<div id="jump-to-nav" class="mw-jump">
Jump to: <a href="#mw-head">navigation</a>, <a href="#p-search">search</a>
</div>
<div id="mw-content-text" lang="en" dir="ltr" class="mw-content-ltr"><table class="metadata plainlinks ambox ambox-content ambox-Unreferenced" role="presentation">
<tr>
<td class="mbox-image">
<div style="width:52px"><a href="/wiki/File:Question_book-new.svg" class="image"><img alt="" src="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/50px-Question_book-new.svg.png" width="50" height="39" srcset="//upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/75px-Question_book-new.svg.png 1.5x, //upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/9/99/Question_book-new.svg/100px-Question_book-new.svg.png 2x" data-file-width="262" data-file-height="204" /></a></div>

<tr>
<td colspan="2" style="text-align:center"><a href="/wiki/HC_Dynamo_Moscow" title="HC Dynamo Moscow">Dynamo Moscow</a><br />
<a href="/wiki/PBC_CSKA_Moscow" title="PBC CSKA Moscow">CSKA Moscow</a></td>

<p><b>VTB Ice Palace</b> (<a href="/wiki/Russian_language" title="Russian language">Russian</a>: <span lang="ru" xml:lang="ru">ВТБ Ледовый дворец</span>), formerly known as <b>Legends Arena</b> (<a href="/wiki/Russian_language" title="Russian language">Russian</a>: <span lang="ru" xml:lang="ru">Арена Легенд</span>) is an indoor multi-sport venue <a href="/wiki/Arena" title="Arena">arena</a> that is located in <a href="/wiki/Moscow,_Russia" title="Moscow, Russia" class="mw-redirect">Moscow, Russia</a>. Its name sponsor is <a href="/wiki/VTB" title="VTB">VTB</a>. The facility features 3 different arenas, the Large Arena, the Small Arena, and a training facility, all housed in the same structure. Both the large and small arenas are multi-purpose venues.</p>
<p>The large arena has a seating capacity of 12,100 viewers for <a href="/wiki/Ice_hockey" title="Ice hockey">ice hockey</a> and <a href="/wiki/Figure_skating" title="Figure skating">figure skating</a>, 13,000 for <a href="/wiki/Basketball" title="Basketball">basketball</a><sup id="cite_ref-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-1"><span>[</span>1<span>]</span></a></sup> and 14,000 for <a href="/wiki/Wrestling" title="Wrestling">wrestling</a>, <a href="/wiki/Boxing" title="Boxing">boxing</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mixed_martial_arts" title="Mixed martial arts">MMA</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Concerts" title="Concerts" class="mw-redirect">concerts</a>. The large arena also has 80 VIP luxury box suites.</p>
<p>The small arena has a seating capacity of 3,500 viewers for <a href="/wiki/Ice_hockey" title="Ice hockey">ice hockey</a> and <a href="/wiki/Figure_skating" title="Figure skating">figure skating</a>, 4,400 for <a href="/wiki/Basketball" title="Basketball">basketball</a> and 5,000 for <a href="/wiki/Wrestling" title="Wrestling">wrestling</a>, <a href="/wiki/Boxing" title="Boxing">boxing</a>, <a href="/wiki/Mixed_martial_arts" title="Mixed martial arts">MMA</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Concerts" title="Concerts" class="mw-redirect">concerts</a>. The third arena, the training arena, has a capacity of 500.<sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2"><span>[</span>2<span>]</span></a></sup></p>
<p>VTB Ice Palace is a part of the Park of Legends big renovation project, at the territory of the former <a href="/wiki/ZiL" title="ZiL">ZiL</a> plant. It includes VTB Ice Palace, the Russian Hockey Museum with the Russian Hockey Hall of Glory, Watersport Arena, and Apartments Complex. VTB Ice Palace is located near by the <a href="/wiki/Avtozavodskaya_(Moscow_Metro)" title="Avtozavodskaya (Moscow Metro)">Avtozavodskaya</a> metro station.</p>
<p></p>

<p></p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="History">History</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=VTB_Ice_Palace&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1" title="Edit section: History">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<p>VTB Ice Palace opened on April 26, 2015. From 2015 onward, VTB Ice Palace will become the home stadium for the <a href="/wiki/Kontinental_Hockey_League" title="Kontinental Hockey League">Kontinental Hockey League</a> ice hockey team <a href="/wiki/HC_Dynamo_Moscow" title="HC Dynamo Moscow">Dynamo Moscow</a>, and the <a href="/wiki/VTB_United_League" title="VTB United League">VTB United League</a> basketball team <a href="/wiki/PBC_CSKA_Moscow" title="PBC CSKA Moscow">CSKA Moscow</a> for <a href="/wiki/Euroleague" title="Euroleague">Euroleague</a> games.</p>
<p>In 2016, the arena will host games of the <a href="/wiki/2016_IIHF_World_Championship" title="2016 IIHF World Championship">2016 IIHF World Championship</a>.</p>
<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Panorama">Panorama</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/w/index.php?title=VTB_Ice_Palace&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2" title="Edit section: Panorama">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<div class="center">
